conclusion: Analyze v-t graph to calculate distance traveled by each particle.
Particle A's velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2v0 over t0 seconds, then decreases linearly back to 0 over the next 2t0 seconds.
Particle B's velocity increases linearly from 0 to v0 over 3t0 seconds, then decreases linearly back to 0 over the next 3t0 seconds.
Calculate distance for Particle A from 0 to t0: Distance = v0 t0.
Calculate distance for Particle A from t0 to 3t0: Distance = 2v0 t0.
Total distance traveled by A by 3t0: Total Distance = 3v0 t0.
Calculate distance for Particle B from 0 to 3t0: Distance = 3/2 v0 t0.
Calculate distance for Particle B from 3t0 to 6t0: Distance = 3/2 v0 t0.
Total distance traveled by B by 6t0: Total Distance = 3v0 t0.
At t = 3t0, both particles have traveled 3v0 t0, so they are at the same position.
Before 3t0, particle A is ahead of particle B.
After 3t0, particle B starts to catch up to particle A.
Particles A and B are farthest apart at t = 3t0.
